messages.message:
Hey, been using the platform in a few demos recently. I’m not keen with the move to the validations to be under the separate tab only.

Customers understand our process as being 3 steps.
• Extract
• Clean 
• Validate 
And the current design validation being under a different tab breaks this mental model slightly. I prefered before where we had both views, with some under the clean section in field config. I never used the validations tab and didn’t feel like I missed anything I needed
Thanks for the feedback, definitely hear you and this is something we will take a look at

Just adding my agreement re flow on this as well. However, I’m also conscious I may be the person “who wants the windows start button on the left” (I’m not), while empirical evidence shows it is better off in the middle for the vast majority of people. Do we do stuff like hotjar that shows us heat maps, user recordings, and a/b testing etc for these types of u/x changes?

@Lee agree as well, I think we can figure out a happy medium but thank you for the feedback!

@alagu re: Bas's question, its something that could be helpful to understand what users are doing. Quantitative UX research

Thanks for the feedback @Lee, will follow up on it. @Kaustubh (KD) we could definitely use some kind of instrumentation/software that provides that info - we currently dont have any thing in place, but def something we should work towards.
On another thread I suggested posthog as a pretty complete option across analytics and heat maps
